title.rendered: Minecraft: Microsoft will lock your account if you don’t act by tomorrow

content.rendered:
MINECRAFT March 09, 2022 at 10:10 am

If you are still using the Minecraft Java Edition, you may be banned from playing by Microsoft from March 10th. But we’ll tell you what you should do.


Microsoft reminds original Minecraft players to transfer their accounts in time. (Source: Screenshot Microsoft)

  • As of March 10th, the Java Edition will no longer be playable without a Microsoft account.
  • However, you can change afterwards.

Microsoft wants to increase security for Minecraft players and requires a Microsoft account for Java Edition players. This is already a requirement for purchases of the game. But if you still have an account from the original version, you can voluntarily only continue until March 10, 2022 switch.

If you don’t switch by then, you can no longer play the Java Edition. While you can switch afterwards and play again with a Microsoft account, Microsoft recommends doing it as early as possible.

These board games provide app support board games

Well-known board games now offer app support, and not just Catan. Whether Lord of the Rings, Star Wars or X-Com: You spice up these titles with your smartphone.

According to an official FAQ, you should have received a message on your Minecraft.net profile page and in the Minecraft launcher that your account is ready for the transfer. The transfer should only take a few minutes and contain all your data such as game progress and skins.

Minecraft is a sandbox game in which players survive in a block world, mine resources and build their own structures. Now there are different versions and modes, Minecraft is popular all over the world.
